Title: History of Modern Design
Description: This course examines the products of the decorative arts and applied design during the past 150 years. Material includes examples of furniture, household objects, industrial design, fashion, and graphic design. The emphasis is not upon a particular design profession or medium, but rather upon how design functions in relation to political, economic, and social history.
College/Department: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
Prerequisites: ARTH 102 [Min Grade: D] or ARTH 103 [Min Grade: D]
